page.title: 09Transport in St.Albans.
page.content: Families in St.Albans have at least one{car}which is used every day.The number of vehicles and accidents are increasing and the{roads are busy } morning and evening,especially on market days.There is a{lorry {restriction}unless delivering.{Bus {fares}are a flat rate but few people use them except children,the elderly and commuters.Long distance{coach {services}are increasing in popularity. St.Albans is a{dormitory town.}10,000 people commute by the fast electric train service to London.3000 people travel into St.Albans to work.The trains reach speeds of 95mph and a yearly season ticket costs Â£765. Children own a {bicycle}but use it to play. Facilities for cyclists are poor;There are few cycle lanes and cycle racks.St.Albans is well positioned for the M1 and M25.
